Google urgently advised its H-1B visa holders abroad to return to the U.S. immediately following President Trump's announcement of a $100,000 fee for new H-1B applications. Read Google’s full ‘urgent’ memo to H-1B visa holders

We are reaching out with an urgent update regarding international travel for individuals on H-1B visas.

A Proclamation is scheduled to take effect this Sunday at 12:01 AM ET. It introduces significant changes to re-entry procedures for H-1B visa holders currently outside the United States. If you are currently outside the US:

If you are currently outside the US with a valid H-1B visa, make plans to return and enter the US before the Proclamation takes effect on Sunday, September 21 at 12:01 am ET (i.e. by this Saturday night).

If you are currently in the US:

We strongly advise against any international travel if you are in valid H-1B status or need to travel to activate your H-1B visa. You should remain in the US

Article Title: Optus outage in Australia: What we know about the fatal triple-0 emergency call failures
Article Text:
Company knew of problems hours before resolution

Optus’ previous failures raise accountability questions





Australia's second-largest telecommunications provider Optus is facing mounting pressure after a 13-hour emergency services outage led to four deaths and caused 600 triple-zero calls to fail across multiple states. The September 19 network failure has prompted government investigations and renewed calls for accountability from the embattled telco.The outage primarily affected South Australia, Western Australia, and the Northern Territory, with some impact also recorded in far western New South Wales near the SA border, according to Reuters reporting. CEO Stephen Rue confirmed that established processes were not followed during a network firewall upgrade that began at 12:30 AM Thursday and lasted until approximately 1:30 PM (local time).Four deaths have been linked to the incident, though South Australian police later clarified that an eight-week-old boy's death in Gawler West was "unlikely" to have been caused by the outage delay. A 68-year-old Adelaide woman and two men aged 74 and 49 in Perth remain connected to the emergency services failure.The Australian Broadcasting Company (ABC) reported that Optus received multiple customer complaints about the triple-zero failure as early as 9 AM Thursday, with five customers contacting the call center about the outage.However, these concerns were not properly escalated, and government authorities weren't informed until after the issue was resolved.Communications Minister Anika Wells expressed "unbelievable disappointment" that Australia was "here again so quickly," referencing a similar 2023 incident. The Australian Media and Communications Authority (ACMA) chair Nerida O'Loughlin revealed her agency wasn't notified until more than 10 hours after the outage began, contrary to standard protocols.This marks the second major triple-zero outage for Optus in less than two years. The company was fined A$12 million in 2023 for failing to provide emergency call services to thousands during a nationwide outage and subsequently failing to conduct required welfare checks.The telecommunications giant, owned by Singapore Telecommunications, has faced a series of crises including a 2022 cyberattack affecting 9.5 million Australians and the 2023 outage that led to former CEO Kelly Bayer Rosmarin's resignation. Current CEO Stephen Rue took over in November 2024.Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, speaking from New York, declined to say whether Rue should resign but indicated the government has "action at its disposal" pending investigation results. ACMA has launched a formal investigation, with Optus potentially facing fines exceeding $10 million and additional penalties.The company has promised full cooperation with all investigations while conducting its own internal review, with results to be made public.
Article Summary: 13-hour emergency services outage led to four deaths and 600 triple-zero calls to fail. Optus received multiple customer complaints about the outage as early as 9 AM Thursday. Government authorities weren't informed until after the issue was resolved. This marks the second major triple- zero outage for Optus in less than two years.

Entrepreneurs like Soundarya Balasubramani, who launched an educational venture in the U.S., are among the new wave of Indian applicants using the O-1 to bypass the H-1B bottleneck. “I got my O-1A approved as the solo founder and 100% owner of an educational venture,” she told ET.

Karan Vaidya, cofounder of AI startup Composio, said his O-1 visa cost less than $10,000 including legal fees, and praised its flexibility: “It’s a three-year visa that can be renewed indefinitely. I’m on my fifth O-1 now.”





US President Donald Trump’s executive order raising the H-1B visa application fee from $10,000 to $1,00,000 sent shockwaves in the tech industry. Due to the announcement last week many tech giants called back their professionals with H-1B visa back to the US. As the scrutiny around the traditional H-1B visa pathway making the process unpredictable, the skilled professionals are now planing to turn towards O-1 visa a lesser known route. The O-1 visa also known as the ‘Einstein visa’ is a specialised non-immigrant visa for individuals with ‘extraordinary ability’ in fields like STEM, arts, business, and sports.For those unaware, the O-1 Visa is introduced under the Immigration Act of 1990. The O-1 visa is a non-immigrant visa for individuals with ‘extraordinary ability’ in fields of education, science, athletics or arts. It enable the recipients to work in the US for up to three years and comes with unlimited renewals. The applicants of the O-1 visa much demonstrate sustained national or international acclaim and meet atleast three out of the eight criteria:After the unpredictable nature of popular H-1B visa, the O-1 visa is gaining a lot of traction among Indians who wish to go and work in the US. As per the report by Economic Times, Indian were granted 487 O-1A visas in FY 2020, this number was increased to 1,418 in FY 2023. With this increase, India became the third largest recipient of O-1 visa after UK and Brazil.Unlike the popularly H-1B visa which is capped at 85,000 visas annually and allocated via a lottery, the O-1 visa has no cap and the applications for it are accepted around the year. The applicants can also expedite the application process by submitting additional fees.Immigration consultant and O-1 holder Logan Ullyott told Business Insider: “The O-1 is an occupation-agnostic visa. You could get it if you’re an engineer, a researcher, an influencer, or even a cook — as long as you can prove you’re at the top of your field.”

Telegram CEO Pavel Durov has revealed his unconventional approach to hiring software engineers: skip the interviews and let candidates compete instead. Winners gain the opportunity to join Telegram's lean engineering team of approximately 30 developers. According to Durov, this approach eliminates the need for an HR department while ensuring candidates possess both technical excellence and genuine familiarity with the product.Durov prioritizes hiring engineers who already use Telegram, believing prior experience provides crucial understanding that newcomers lack. By promoting contests directly through Telegram, the company naturally attracts user-candidates.The strategy has proven lucrative for winners. In June, Durov announced a competition offering a $1 million annual salary for an Android developer position, with the challenge requiring contestants to implement specific animations in Telegram's open-source app.Durov has employed this hiring method since 2007, during his tenure as CEO of Russian social network VK, before cofounding Telegram with his brother Nikolai in 2013. The contests serve dual purposes: recruiting top talent while crowdsourcing innovative solutions to real development challenges facing the platform.

Article Title: OpenAI launches Instant Checkout, making ChatGPT your go-to hub for AI shopping and seamless online purchases
Article Text:
ChatGPT becomes a shopping companion with Instant Checkout and agentic commerce



What is Instant Checkout



Instant Checkout: Seamless shopping for users and opportunities for merchants



Agentic Commerce protocol: Making Instant Checkout easy and secure



Key features of the Agentic Commerce Protocol include:

Cross-platform compatibility: Works with various payment processors and business types.

Quick integration: Merchants can adopt ACP without overhauling their backend systems.

Merchant control: Ensures merchants remain the primary point of contact for fulfillment, returns, support, and communication.

Future of agentic commerce







How to start using Instant Checkout



Also Read |





OpenAI is advancing agentic commerce, turning ChatGPT from a virtual assistant into an active shopping partner. With the launch of Instant Checkout, powered by the Agentic Commerce Protocol, users can now browse, select, and purchase products directly within the chat interface, eliminating the need to visit multiple websites. Initially available to US ChatGPT users, Instant Checkout allows seamless single-item purchases from Etsy sellers, with support for over a million Shopify merchants, including brands like Glossier, SKIMS, and Spanx, coming soon. The Agentic Commerce Protocol ensures secure, efficient transactions while keeping merchants in control of fulfillment, payments, and customer relationships. This innovation is set to transform online shopping, offering convenience for users and a new revenue channel for businesses.Every week, over 700 million people turn to ChatGPT for help with everyday tasks, including product recommendations. With the introduction of Instant Checkout, ChatGPT moves beyond suggestions and enables users to make purchases directly through the chat interface.Initially, this feature is available to US ChatGPT Plus, Pro, and Free users, allowing purchases directly from US-based Etsy sellers. Over a million Shopify merchants, including Glossier, SKIMS, Spanx, and Vuori, are expected to join soon.Currently, Instant Checkout supports single-item purchases, with plans to expand to multi-item carts, more merchants, and international regions in the near future.Instant Checkout allows users to go from product discovery to purchase with just a few taps. When a user asks ChatGPT for shopping recommendations—such as “best running shoes under $100” or “gifts for a ceramics lover”—ChatGPT provides organic, unsponsored product results ranked purely by relevance.If a product supports Instant Checkout, users can simply tap “Buy,” confirm shipping and payment details, and complete the purchase without leaving the chat. Payments can be made with the card on file for existing subscribers or through other supported payment methods.Orders, payments, and fulfillment are entirely handled by the merchant’s existing systems. ChatGPT acts as a digital personal shopper, securely transmitting order details between the user and merchant.For shoppers, Instant Checkout offers a seamless, convenient shopping experience, eliminating the need to visit multiple websites. For merchants, it opens the door to hundreds of millions of potential customers while allowing them to maintain full control over payments, fulfillment, and customer relationships.Merchants pay a small fee on completed purchases, but the service is free for users. Importantly, Instant Checkout does not influence product ranking, ensuring fairness in recommendations. ChatGPT evaluates products based on availability, price, quality, and seller status to optimize the user experience.At the heart of Instant Checkout is the Agentic Commerce Protocol (ACP), an open standard designed to enable AI agents, people, and businesses to collaborate on completing purchases. Co-developed with Stripe and leading merchants, the protocol is designed to be secure, easy to adopt, and platform-agnostic.When a user places an order through ChatGPT, the protocol securely transmits the purchase details to the merchant’s backend. The merchant then processes the payment, handles fulfillment, and provides customer support using their existing systems. Merchants using Stripe can enable agentic payments with just one line of code, while other payment processors can participate via ACP’s Shared Payment Token API or Delegated Payments Spec.OpenAI is open-sourcing the Agentic Commerce Protocol, allowing developers and merchants to build their own integrations. This move encourages innovation, enabling businesses to create seamless AI-driven commerce experiences across platforms and regions. Interested merchants can apply to make their products available for purchase through ChatGPT, unlocking a new channel to reach millions of users.The launch of Instant Checkout represents a significant leap toward agentic AI in commerce. Previously, AI agents could recommend products but could not complete transactions. Now, ChatGPT can act as a fully capable shopping assistant, bridging the gap between discovery and purchase.This innovation also positions OpenAI at the forefront of a competitive landscape. Tech giants like Google and Microsoft are developing similar AI-powered shopping tools, while Amazon faces potential disruption as chatbots redirect consumers away from traditional storefronts. By working directly with Shopify merchants and offering an open-source protocol, OpenAI is not only reshaping the online shopping experience but also redefining the power dynamics in ecommerce, putting AI agents at the center of the purchase journey.For users in the US, Instant Checkout is available for single-item purchases from Etsy sellers. Support for Shopify merchants and other retailers will roll out in phases. Users enjoy effortless shopping, while merchants gain unprecedented access to a global audience—all without sacrificing control over their systems. This marks the beginning of agentic commerce, a new era where AI agents don’t just suggest what to buy—they help you buy it.

Article Title: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra clarifies UPI fee statement, says: I never said that ...

Government mulls digital locking of phones on credit

H-1B Visa Shock Explained: $100K Annual Fee Announced by Donald Trump





Reserve Bank of India (RBI) governor Sanjay Malhotra has said that there is no proposal to levy charges on Unified Payments Interface (UPI) transactions, says a report by news agency PTI. Speaking at a press conference after the monetary policy review, Malhotra clarified that despite the sharp rise in UPI usage, the central bank has not received or considered any proposal to impose transaction fees. “I never said that UPI can stay free forever. What I said was there are costs (associated with UPI transactions), and they need to be paid for by someone”, Malhotra said.According to the RBI data, UPI transactions crossed 20 billion in August 2025, a 34 per cent increase in volume year-on-year. “Is there going to be charges on UPI? Well, there is no proposal before us,” he said during the conference as quoted in the PTI report. “Who pays is important but not so important than someone footing the bill. So, it is important for us for the sustainability of the model, that whether collectively or individually someone pays," Sanjay Malhotra said.The RBI governor has previously raised concerns about the sustainability of UPI’s zero-cost framework.Speaking at an event earlier this year, Malhotra said “The important thing is that the UPI, or any other payment system for that matter, is accessible, cheap, secure, and sustainable… and it will be sustainable only if someone bears the costs. So as long as it’s the government or someone else — that’s not so important — the important thing is that costs of any service should be paid, whether collectively or by the user. ”The governor also said the RBI is reviewing a plan that would allow banks to remotely lock mobile phones bought on credit if borrowers default on their EMI payments.The PTI report quotes RBI Deputy Governor M Rajeshwar Rao who said “The issue of digital locking is under examination as the Governor has pointed out. There are pros and cons on both sides in terms of balancing customer rights and requirements, data privacy, and creditors' requirements. So, we are examining the issue, we will...take a view at a later point in time”.
Article Summary: RBI governor Sanjay Malhotra has said that there is no proposal to levy charges on Unified Payments Interface (UPI) transactions. The governor also said the RBI is reviewing a plan that would allow banks to remotely lock mobile phones bought on credit if borrowers default.

In India’s rapidly growing digital ecosystem, messaging apps are central to communication, and Arattai and WhatsApp have emerged as key players with distinct approaches. Launched in January 2021 by Chennai-based Zoho Corporation, Arattai is a homegrown app designed to support India’s linguistic diversity, low-end devices, and slower networks, reflecting the “Atmanirbhar Bharat” initiative. Endorsed by Indian government leaders, it prioritises regional relevance, accessibility, and digital sovereignty. In contrast, WhatsApp, acquired by Meta in 2014, is a global messaging giant serving over 3 billion users worldwide. Known for its end-to-end encryption, feature richness, and reliability, WhatsApp is deeply embedded in India’s digital culture, connecting both urban professionals and rural users alike.Arattai launched in January 2021, developed by Chennai-based Zoho Corporation. Its name, derived from Tamil, means “casual chat.” Built under India’s Atmanirbhar Bharat initiative, Arattai emphasises local relevance, accessibility, and digital sovereignty. Supported by Indian government endorsements from leaders like Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan and IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw, the app is optimised for low-end smartphones, slower networks, and regional language support.WhatsApp, acquired by Meta in 2014, is the world’s most widely used messaging platform. Known for its reliability, end-to-end encryption, and feature richness, it is deeply embedded in India’s communication culture, serving both urban professionals and rural users alike.Arattai stands out for its strong support of India’s linguistic diversity. Its lightweight design ensures smooth performance on older smartphones and 2G/3G networks, making it highly accessible to rural users and those with budget devices.WhatsApp provides a polished messaging experience with support for multiple global languages, including Indian languages. However, concerns remain due to Meta’s involvement in data monetisation.Arattai encrypts voice and video calls but not text messages, which may raise concerns for some users. Its servers are India-based, aligning with the country’s digital sovereignty goals, and Zoho’s strict no-data-monetisation policy ensures user data is not used for advertising.Arattai offers high-definition voice and video calls optimised for low-bandwidth conditions, ensuring reliable connectivity even in rural areas. Group calls are supported, and encryption adds an extra layer of safety.WhatsApp also provides high-quality calls and supports group calls for up to eight participants. Its global infrastructure ensures consistent performance for international communication, also backed by end-to-end encryption.Arattai supports group chats of up to 1,000 members and features broadcast channels for one-way communication, ideal for local creators and businesses.WhatsApp allows slightly larger groups of up to 1,024 members with advanced admin controls, pinned messages, and a well-used channel system for businesses and communities.Arattai supports file sharing up to 1 GB and includes a stories feature for temporary updates. Media transfers are optimised for slower networks.WhatsApp allows file sharing up to 2 GB and offers a polished status feature widely adopted for sharing updates. Its media handling is seamless and user-friendly.Arattai introduces a unique “Pocket” feature, a personal storage space for notes, photos, videos, and reminders. It allows users to organise personal content without cluttering other chats.WhatsApp offers a “Chat with Yourself” feature for similar purposes, providing a streamlined way to save personal media and tasks with end-to-end encryption. While both apps offer comparable functionality, Arattai’s Pocket is purpose-built for personal organisation.Arattai provides straightforward tools for local creators, including channels and content-sharing. A dedicated Meetings tab allows users to schedule and manage professional interactions, similar to Microsoft Teams.WhatsApp offers a robust Business platform with payment integration, catalogs, and Meta ecosystem connectivity. However, it lacks built-in meeting scheduling options.Arattai is lightweight and optimised for low-end devices and slow networks, making it a strong choice for rural or resource-constrained users.WhatsApp, while compatible with multiple devices, is resource-intensive due to its extensive features, which may challenge older devices or slower connections.Arattai is ad-free, delivering a distraction-free, clean experience in line with Zoho’s user-first philosophy.WhatsApp may incorporate ad-driven features as part of Meta’s ecosystem, which some users find intrusive.The choice ultimately depends on user priorities:Both apps bring unique strengths to India’s messaging landscape. WhatsApp excels in security, polished features, and global connectivity, making it ideal for businesses and urban professionals. Arattai is lightweight, ad-free, and India-focused, appealing to users valuing accessibility, regional languages, and digital sovereignty.
Article Summary: Arattai launched in January 2021, developed by Chennai-based Zoho Corporation. Its name, derived from Tamil, means “casual chat” Built under India’s Atmanirbhar Bharat initiative, Arattai emphasises local relevance, accessibility, and digital sovereignty. WhatsApp, acquired by Meta in 2014, is a global messaging giant serving over 3 billion users worldwide.

Article Title: Abhishek Bachchan and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan takes Google to court; wants judge to tell YouTube to...
Article Text:
YouTube's AI training policy under fire

Growing concern for celebrity rights in India





Bollywood stars Abhishek Bachchan and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan have taken Google 's YouTube to court in New Delhi, demanding protection against AI-generated videos that misuse their personas and seeking safeguards to prevent such content from training other artificial intelligence platforms.The high-profile lawsuit, filed on September 6, targets deepfake and misleading YouTube videos that the actors claim infringe their intellectual property rights. Beyond requesting removal of existing AI content, the couple wants Google to implement measures ensuring uploaded videos cannot be used to train rival AI models without proper consent, according to legal documents reviewed by Reuters.The Bachchans argue that YouTube's current policy—which allows creators to opt in for sharing their videos to train AI platforms like OpenAI , Meta, and xAI—is deeply concerning. They contend that biased or negative AI content portraying them could teach AI models false information, leading to further spread of misleading material.The lawsuits, spanning 1,500 pages, include hundreds of links and screenshots showing what the actors describe as "egregious" and "sexually explicit" AI-manipulated videos. One example shows Abhishek using AI manipulation to kiss an actress, while another depicts Aishwarya dining with her former partner, actor Salman Khan , as Abhishek watches angrily.The Delhi High Court has already ordered 518 website links and posts to be removed, citing financial harm and damage to the couple's dignity.The next hearing is scheduled for January 15, with the actors seeking $450,000 in damages and a permanent injunction.Reuters found numerous similar infringing videos still on YouTube, including a channel called "AI Bollywood Ishq" with 259 videos garnering 16.5 million views. The case represents the most significant legal challenge yet regarding personality rights and AI in India, where explicit protections for celebrity personas don't exist unlike in many U.S. states.With India being YouTube's largest market at around 600 million users, the lawsuit could significantly impact how the platform handles AI-generated celebrity content and video-sharing consent policies, Reuters reported.
Article Summary: Bollywood stars Abhishek Bachchan and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan have taken Google's YouTube to court in New Delhi. Article Title: Judge calls out 'stupidity' of 300 bankers of America's largest bank JP Morgan Chase while sentencing Charlie Javice, once called 'wonder' CEO
Article Text:
Charlie Javice, the 20-something women CEO who 'fooled' JP Morgan

What Charlie Javice's lawyers said in her defense





A Manhattan judge didn't hold back, using unusually blunt language to describe JP Morgan's bankers as victims of a massive fraud, but at the same time chiding them for their "stupidity". According to a report from Business Insider, US District Judge Alvin K Hellerstein sentenced fintech founder Charlie Javice to seven years in prison and ordered her to pay $287.5 million in restitution.It was halfway through the hearing that the judge began his scathing criticism of the bank's due diligence. "What consideration should be given for JPMorgan Chase's very poor due diligence?" Hellerstein asked. But he went on to add that Fraud remains a fraud "whether you outsmart someone who is smart or someone who is a fool."Javice, who once appeared on Forbes' "30 Under 30" list, was found guilty of defrauding America's largest bank JP Morgan Chase in the 2021 sale of her startup, Frank. The bank paid $175 million for the company, believing it had access to a database of 4 million college students. It was later revealed that Javice had fabricated the data, using a computer programmer to create a fake list of users.JP Morgan did not discover the fraud until a year after the acquisition was finalized, despite a team of 300 in-house diligence officers vetting the deal.The prosecution described Frank as "a crime scene," not a viable business.Javice, who had previously attracted high-profile investors, even managed to secure one-on-one meeting with JP Morgan CEO Jamie Dimon.During the sentencing, the judge was unswayed by the defense's argument that JP Morgan, a bank worth nearly $4 trillion, should have known better. In a striking statement, Judge Hellerstein declared that his job was "punishing her conduct and not JPMorgan's stupidity." He emphasized that "fraud remains a fraud, whether you outsmart someone who is smart or someone who is a fool."The defense had pointed to trial evidence showing that one bank executive had scoffed at the sale price, calling it "nothing." Yet, the judge insisted that blaming the victim, even a banking giant, was irrelevant. "Whether you outsmart someone who is indifferent or someone who is careful, it's the conduct," he said.
Article Summary: Charlie Javice sentenced to seven years in prison and ordered to pay $287.5 million in restitution. She was found guilty of defrauding JP Morgan Chase in the 2021 sale of her startup, Frank. Article Title: More than 90% companies have seen their AI investments failing and blame for this should go to ..., says study
Article Text:
MIT study says 95% of Gen-AI pilots at companies are failing





A new study has tried to reason the biggest complaint that majority of companies have with their AI investment -- that they give zero return. A recent MIT study had put the figure of AI investment failures at 95%. Now a study from researchers at consulting company BetterUp Labs, in collaboration with Stanford Social Media Lab, has reasoned the AI failure with a new term -- "workslop". The study coins the new term to describe low-quality, AI-generated work: “Workslop.”Published in the Harvard Business Review, the research highlights how Workslop may explain why 95% of organizations experimenting with AI report no return on investment. Workslop, defined as “AI-generated work content that masquerades as good work, but lacks the substance to meaningfully advance a given task,” is often unhelpful, incomplete, or missing critical context. The researchers warn that it shifts the burden downstream, forcing others to interpret, correct, or redo the work.The researchers also conducted an ongoing survey of 1,150 full-time, U.S.-based employees, with 40% of respondents saying they’d received Workslop in the past month.To combat Workslop, researchers urge workplace leaders to model intentional AI use and establish clear guidelines for acceptable practices. “Leaders must set guardrails around norms to ensure AI contributes meaningfully,” the study advises.The findings highlight the need for thoughtful integration of AI tools to avoid creating more work rather than less.A recent MIT study indicates that 95% of organizations studied get zero return on their AI investment. The study said that 95% of organizations found zero return despite enterprise investment of $30 billion to $40 billion into GenAI. MIT researchers are said to have studied 300 public AI initiatives to try and suss out the "no hype reality" of AI's impact on business.
Article Summary: A recent MIT study indicates that 95% of organizations studied get zero return on their AI investment. Now a study from researchers at consulting company BetterUp Labs has reasoned the AI failure with a new term -- "workslop" The study coins the new term to describe low-quality, AI-generated work.

Spotify founder and CEO Daniel Ek has announced that he is stepping down from his role as the CEO effective from January 1, 2026. Ek will transition to the position of executive chairman, while longtime executives Gustav Söderström and Alex Norström will take over as co-CEOs. They will report to Daniel Ek and will also serve on the company’s Board of Directors subject to shareholder approval.In a letter to employees, Ek reflected on Spotify’s journey from a startup to a global audio leader with more than 700 million users:“I always believed that Spotify could play an important role in revolutionizing listening around the world, and with more than 700 million users, we’ve truly charted a new course bringing creativity to every corner of the globe,” said Daniel Ek.“Over the last few years, I’ve turned over a large part of the day-to-day management and strategic direction of Spotify to Alex and Gustav–who have shaped the company from our earliest days and are now more than ready to guide our next phase. This change simply matches titles to how we already operate. In my role as Executive Chairman, I will focus on the long arc of the company and keep the Board and our co-CEOs deeply connected through my engagement.This move by Daniel Ek formalises the leadership structure which has been in place since 2023 with Söderström (Chief Product & Technology Officer) and Norström (Chief Business Officer) already steering much of Spotify’s strategic and operational direction. As Executive Chairman, Ek will focus on capital allocation, long-term strategy, and board engagement, in a role modeled after the European chairman system.Woody Marshall, Lead Independent Director of Spotify’s Board, said the transition had been in planning for years: “We have tremendous confidence in Alex and Gustav as they step into these roles… We are also thrilled that Daniel will be actively involved, giving Spotify both founder-led strategic stewardship and mentorship to the co-CEOs.”In a joint statement, Söderström and Norström said: “We’ve worked together a very long time and have seen Spotify through many different chapters… While we bring different experiences and perspectives to the CEO role, we both have a strong bias to action and can’t wait to get started knowing that we will have Daniel’s full partnership and ongoing support.”

They will report to Daniel Ek and will also serve on the company’s Board of Directors.

Article Title: Apple CEO Tim Cook spotted again in one-of-its-kind Nike shoes; watch photos
Article Text:
A unique cultural collaboration



Image courtesy: Business Insider

Nike ties run deep







Apple CEO Tim Cook has once again made headlines for his footwear. Cook recently wore a pair of customised Nike sneakers at the reopening of Apple’s flagship store in Tokyo. As reported by Business Insider, Cook was seen sporting a custom pair of Nike Vomero Plus sneakers at the company’s store opening in Japan. Some visitors at the store clicked photos and also made videos of the sneakers.As reported by Business Insider, Tim Cook’s Nike sneakers have red, white and blue colours. The sneakers are designed by Sashiko Gals, an artisan collective under the Japanese brand Kuon. The group consists of around 15 women aged between 40 and 80 and it specialises in sashiko, a traditional Japanese stitching technique.The sneakers are made using reworked denim and are a blend of modern sportswear with traditional craftsmanship. According to the designers, the pair was created exclusively for Cook.Presently, it is not clear that whether Nike is directly involved in the customisation process of the sneakers. However, Cook’s connection to the sportswear giant is longstanding—he has served on Nike’s board of directors since 2005. Over the years, Apple and Nike have collaborated on several projects, including fitness features and Apple Watch editions.This is not the first time that Cook has grabbed attention due to his sneakers. Last year, Cook wore another pair of one-of-a-kind Nike shoes at the time of the launch of new iPad lineup at an Apple event. The sightings suggest that Cook has access to a personal collection of rare, custom-designed sneakers, a perk few CEOs can claim.
Article Summary: Apple CEO Tim Cook has once again made headlines for his footwear. Cook wore a pair of customised Nike sneakers at the reopening of Apple’s flagship store in Tokyo. The sneakers are designed by Sashiko Gals, an artisan collective under the Japanese brand Kuon.
